titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Queens County Surrogate's Court summons to Nathaniel Mills 1977.507
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

did.unittitle: Queens County Surrogate's Court summons to Nathaniel Mills
did.abstract: An 1892 summons from the Queens County Surrogate's Court to Nathaniel Mills of 1393 Pacific Street in Brooklyn regarding the estate of Elias J. Hendrickson.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of William A. Eardeley, date unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Queens County Surrogate's Court summons to Nathaniel Mills, 1977.507, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Summons from the Queens County Surrogate's Court to Nathaniel Mills of 1393 Pacific Street in Brooklyn. The summons orders Mills, an executor of the estate of Elias J. Hendrickson of Hollis, Queens County, to appear in the Queens County Surrogate's Office in Jamaica for the probate of Hendrickson's last will and testament. It is dated February 4, 1892.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
